intro: Parablechnum revolutum, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are leathery and have a distinctive revolute margin, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is often cultivated for its hardiness and ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
